ratings.comment: Don't take this class/professor for fun. He grades only on two midterms and a final, in which essays are the heaviest weight. He does not give essays a score above 94%, and 93% is the grade cut off for an A, so do not take this as an easy A class, despite it being "easy" insofar as no homework/papers due. He is a poor lecturer with no organization.

He's the definition of average. He has a very cool accent and seems to be a super nice guy who definitely knows his stuff, but lectures can be really boring. I almost never went to class but did the readings and did very well. You can either go to class or do the readings, you don't really have to do both. Exams are essay and pretty easy.
overall an amazing guy, also, he has a british accent. he is golden

Professor Sommerville is insanely knowledgeable about the subject matter and loves to talk about it. He also loves questions in class and jokes about hard cider for that matter. Not the most organized lecture slides, but he's easy enough to follow. You can totally just read the textbook and never go to class but his lectures are fun.
Great professor! Show up to lecture and study the material on the website and you'll be fine. Very nice and interesting guy

I'd recommend this class to any freshman or sophomore looking for relatively simple humanities credits. The class seems like a lot of work initially, but I quickly realized the textbook reading is completely unnecessary because you're tested only on what's on the PowerPoint. You're assigned a lot of reading, but it's completely optional. I wouldn't recommend buying the textbook. The class is very lecture heavy, the class is basically Sommerville talking at you on stage for an hour and fifteen minutes. He gives a ton of information but it's very simple to figure out what you will be tested on because he spends a disproportionate amount of time on those topics. Two exams, 10% MC and 90% essay, graded by the TA, and he is relatively lenient so it isn't hard to do well. You barely even have to know dates or most unimportant names. Final is a 5 day take home final with just 2 essay questions  Overall, I liked the material, Sommerville's British accent makes it interesting and he makes a witty joke maybe once a lecture. You should take his class!

I thoroughly enjoyed his lectures and would definitely like to take another class taught by him. While there is a steady amount of reading assigned, he covers everything in class as well and the material is interesting.
interesting lecture, but a little confusing.
Very confusing lectures, I spent most of the time on Wikipedia learning myself. Nice and personable when you go to office hours. You will get a good grade if you can write well.

Took two classes in one semester with this prof but he was a good lecturer so it wasn't too bad at all. He is a fair grader in 367, the TA in 123 was a bit tougher. Prof is helpful & friendly. Brings up a lot of fun anecdotes. Slides are clear & well done. Tests & papers not easy but not too stressful. Overall, good classes with a skilled lecturer.

Professor Sommerville is one of the best professors I've had so far at UW. He is so understanding and flexible. Really charming and funny guy as well.h Showing up to lecture is a must or else you will be lost. Same for taking notes. The exams are very fair and he gives students a good idea of what to expect on exams beforehand.

One of the most helpful professors I have had at UW-Madison! I enjoyed taking 126 with him so much I took 361. He is super knowledgable and has an accent that makes listening in lectures very enjoyable.  He sometimes goes off on tangents but they end up giving you fun facts to pull out at parties.

2 midterms and a final (for three credits) and an optional paper for four credits. The paper and and exams (blue books) are graded by the TA (at least mine were). Participation in discussion was necessary. The final was actually sent out and we had 3 days to finish it. He bounces around in lectures a lot but his occasional humor is nice. Must read.

Sommerville has a great english accent and is very knowledgeable on the subject. His lecture slides are basically just words stacked together, with no terms, so you cant zone out. Also, the book has great info, but its a really dry read and doesnt have bold terms or a glossary. I just google searched stuff i didnt know. Go to section and participat

Great lecturer, made even the driest aspects of English history seem interesting. His tests are really easy if you know the material and can write a decent essay. His side tangents are hilarious and add a slew of depth to the class. Truly a pleasure learning English history from him, especially considering his English accent. Would take again.

Dr. Sommerville is veeery knowledgeable about the topic. The lectures are very interesting to listen to, especially with his English accent. The slideshows are sort of hard to follow, but as long as you listen you'll be fine. There is a lot of reading to do and the tests are a pain to study for but they are very easily graded.

Good professor, very knowledgeable.  He has a bad habit of jumping around from slide to slide that makes it difficult to follow sometimes, but if you just listen to what he's saying it's not too bad.  Good sense of humor, British accent isn't difficult to get used to. Overall good class.
Generally a good prof.  Exams are one heavily weighted essay which are generally easy to predicy.  Grade heavily determined by writing.  Lectures pretty dull but can be pretty funny at times

This class is so good. I had no interest in this time period but I found the fifty minutes of lecture flew by because I was enthralled.  Sommerville is an excellent lecturer and his accent is boss. No reading is actually required.  Midterms, final, and paper are all par for the course in terms of history classes, just read/memorize lecture notes.
Great professor, interesting lecturer. Super knowledgeable about the time period and loves when students ask questions. 2 midterms and a final, all essays but not difficult.

This was my second class with him and I intend to continue taking his classes. He's funny if you're paying enough attention to catch his jokes, and he keeps his lectures interesting with side stories. Learned a lot in his class and the exams aren't too difficult.

He's the kind of guy who makes a Lord of the Rings joke applicable to what we're learning in lecture. Reading was pretty heavy, and the TA expected you to be ready to contribute. Other than that, I wrote the extra paper for a 4th credit and pulled out a solid A w/ honors in the course. Lectures can drag (2hrs!) but he's a great guy.
Wasn't especially interesting to me... but exam topics were given and if you just studied those topics you could do fine on the exams. Exams were essays, some multiple choice/matching as well.

Maybe my favorite class so far at Madison. Prof. Sommerville was very entertaining to listen to and the exams were very fair. If there's a downside, he is sort of disorganized, and is pretty averse to using technology. Reading is assigned by the TA, expected to post some observations on the reading online each week.
Great professor overall! We had a pretty bad TA, but a very informative experience.

Solid history professor. If you don't like writing papers, take the 3-credit non-honors and you'll only have three exams. He's got a great British accent and is pretty easy to understand. Classes can be a bit boring from time to time but usually it's worth it to attend lecture. Highly recommended.

Johann is an amazing prof! He is extremely knowledgeable and clearly loves English History. Write the optional 5-6 page paper for a credit its worth it. Beyond that 2 midterms and a final mostly essay based. Great class Johann is someone to take at Madison!

Excellent professor! He makes history seem like an exciting story, and peppers his lectures with interesting anecdotes. Notes are online, but go to lectures--they're fun! He makes learning the material pretty easy.
A little hard to understand because of his british accent, but he is really knowledgeable and mildly funny at times.  Not the most fun class, but after all, its the History of England.  Solid prof.

Great Professor, easy to understand British accent. Tests were extremely easy if you knew the material. 4 credit students have to write a 3-5 page paper on the topics provided.(or get a topic ok'd by Sommerville or the TA) Honors students write 1 more paper.  3 credit students don't have a paper.  Overall great class even if you don't love history.

Awesome professor with a British accent (easy to understand though). Uses key words and phrases on powerpoints to help students follow along, but has lecture material online as well. Had great TAs for the class too. I thought this class was extremely interesting, but maybe just because I love history anyway.
GReat Professor, easy class, tests are very straight forward.
pretty easy class. Interesting, takes a lecture or two to get used to his accent. One of my better professors.

A funny old english guy, keeps the class fairly entertaining. Really knowledgeable. really good TAs which make the class alot easier, they grade mostly everything. Exams cover alot but arent too difficult, a really good class if you like history

Really knows his English history. Very educated with a Cambridge degree. Mumbley, old-man British accent. Loves what he teaches. You might end up dozing off in lecture if you're not interested in what he's lecturing. Has great TA's. Tests really not that difficult. Good class if you enjoy history.
Uniquely funny, occasionally hard to understand. He is fair grader, though expects high quality especially from honor students. Fun class and super interesting. Good class to take for fun.
One of the more interesting professors I've had. He tells jokes all the time, but in this very unique way where it is impossible to know he is telling a joke until the punchline comes.

Sommerville knows early-modern European history backwards and forwards.  If you are looking for a really interesting class, take his seminar - or any of his other classes.  The grading is fair, and for the most part the workload is pretty light.

Awesome guy, know tons and tons about british and european history, lectures are interesting and the reading isn't bad at all. material weighted heavily on political and constitutional history if thats your thing. Highly recommend this class or any other by Sommerville.
Pretty easy class, discussions mandatory. He is all over the place in his lectures, not extremely organized.
This guys knows his stuff (Cambridge educated), plus you get to listen to an English accent for 3 hours per week.

I took both of Sommerville's classes, 123 and 367.  If you like English History, take these classes!  Lectures are sometimes dull but the occasional Monty Python references are worth it.  Exams in both classes were the same, 5 MC questions and an essay, not too bad.  The final is word-limited and NOT FUN! Overall, knowledgeable and good prof.

I never had to ask Sommerville questions because my TA was amazing. If he continues to choose TAs like Lesley, the class will probably reamain as interesting and easy to comprehend. AND unlike another person on here, I found his little words on the board very heplful! They guided me in notetaking and reminded me of what he said if I got off track.

Sommerville is an interesting guy that can be fun to listen to during lecture. His exams consist of 5 multiple choice questions and a choice of one essay question from three. You will probably know what the questions will be about before you walk into the exam. The only negative is that he writes on the board in an unorganized way.

Extremely knowledgeable teacher who presents his material in an interesting and coherent fashion.  If you like English history, or history in general, I highly recommend him.  He does tend to grade essays and papers a little tough, but if you know the material you should have no trouble getting an A.

Great professor, knows his stuff. I took the class for Honors and got an A, but if history isn't your thing I would avoid the extra honors/4th credit work. His responses to individual questions tended to be vague so I just went to my TA before writing papers. Great class if you're into English history and don't mind working a bit harder for an A.

good teacher. has great outlines. if you go to all the lectures and take notes its easy to do well in the class because his midterms (essays) are covered in his notes. and if taking good notes, you wont have to read but will still do very well.

His tests are fair and cover material that was covered at length in class. At times he is hard to understand, but for the most part his accent is more fun than a hinderance. His lectures cover a lot but nothing that is overly difficult to grasp and there's even the occasional reference to Monty Python or bad English food.

Just don't take him for Honors, because if you do (like I did) he grades everything himself. He doesn't ever give you anything higher than a 94% ever...no matter what...and a 92% is the cutoff for an A. The TA told me I deserved an A (if he would have graded my stuff)...but Sommerville gave me an AB
Quirky British guy with a slightly difficult lecture style. Exams are fair. Grading is fair. If you go to class and read the book, you'll be okay. If you don't, you're screwed.
Very knowledgable and a great lecturer.  Got to love his British accent ;).  Material is occasionally on the boring end.
